text: Pope Alexander IV (; c. 1185 â€“ 25 May 1261), born Rinaldo Conti di Segni, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church. He was the 182nd Pope from 1254 until his death. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-18. ==Early life== Rinaldo Conti di Segni was born into the family of the counts of Segni. His relations included Pope Innocent III and Pope Gregory IX."Pope Alexander IV", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-18. ==Cardinal== In 1227, Gregory IX made Conti a cardinal. ==Pope== Cardinal Conti was elected pope on December 12, 1254. He chose to be called Alexander IV. Pope Alexander was involved in Italian and European political disputes. The pope tried and failed to affect politics in the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies. ==Related pages== * List of popes * List of popes from the Conti family ==References== ==Other websites== * * Catholic Hierarchy, Popes in sequence * GCatholic, Pope Alexander IV * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Cardinal Conti di Segni Category:Italian popes Category:1180s births Category:1261 deaths
